com.almasb.fxgl.app

Class GameApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • com.almasb.fxgl.app.FXGLApplication
        • com.almasb.fxgl.app.GameApplication

  • public abstract class GameApplication
extends FXGLApplication
    To use FXGL extend this class and implement necessary methods. The initialization process can be seen below (irrelevant phases are omitted):

    1. Instance fields of YOUR subclass of GameApplication
    2. initSettings()
    3. Services configuration (after this you can safely call FXGL.getService())
    4. initAchievements()
    5. initInput()
    6. preInit()

      7. The following phases are NOT executed on UI thread

    7. initAssets()
    8. initGame() OR loadState()
    9. initPhysics()
    10. initUI()
    11. Start of main game loop execution on UI thread

    Unless explicitly stated, methods are not thread-safe and must be executed on the JavaFX Application (UI) Thread. By default all callbacks are executed on the JavaFX Application (UI) Thread.

    Callback / listener notes: instance of GameApplication will always be notified last along the chain of callbacks. However, as per documentation, events are always fired after listeners.

    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • getState

        public final ApplicationState getState()
        Returns:
        current application state

        physics world

        Returns:

      • initSceneFactory

        protected SceneFactory initSceneFactory()
        Override to provide custom intro/loading/menu scenes.
        Returns:
        scene factory

      • initAchievements

        protected void initAchievements()
        Override to register your achievements. 
         Example:

 AchievementManager am = getAchievementManager();
 am.registerAchievement(new Achievement("Score Master", "Score 20000 points"));

      • initInput

        protected abstract void initInput()
        Initialize input, i.e. bind key presses, bind mouse buttons.

        Note: This method is called prior to any game init to register input mappings in the menus. 

         Example:

 Input input = getInput();
 input.addAction(new UserAction("Move Left") {
      protected void onAction() {
          playerControl.moveLeft();
      }
 }, KeyCode.A);

      • preInit

        protected void preInit()
        This is called after core services are initialized but before any game init. Called only once per application lifetime.

      • initAssets

        protected abstract void initAssets()
        Initialize game assets, such as Texture, Sound, Music, etc.

      • saveState

        protected DataFile saveState()
        Called when MenuEvent.SAVE occurs. Note: if you enable menus, you are responsible for providing appropriate serialization of your game state. Otherwise an exception will be thrown when save is called.
        Returns:
        data with required info about current state
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if was not overridden

      • loadState

        protected void loadState(DataFile dataFile)
        Called when MenuEvent.LOAD occurs. Note: if you enable menus, you are responsible for providing appropriate deserialization of your game state. Otherwise an exception will be thrown when load is called.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - previously saved data
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - if was not overridden

      • initGame

        protected abstract void initGame()
        Initialize game objects.

      • initPhysics

        protected abstract void initPhysics()
        Initialize collision handlers, physics properties.

      • initUI

        protected abstract void initUI()
        Initialize UI objects.

      • onUpdate

        protected abstract void onUpdate(double tpf)
        Main loop update phase, most of game logic.
        Parameters:
        tpf - time per frame

      • onPostUpdate

        protected void onPostUpdate(double tpf)
        Called after main loop tick has been completed. It can be used to de-register callbacks / listeners and call various methods that otherwise might interfere with main loop.
        Parameters:
        tpf - time per frame (same as main update tpf)

      • isMenuOpen

        public boolean isMenuOpen()
        Returns:
        true if any menu is open

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        true if game is paused or menu is open

      • startNewGame

        protected void startNewGame()
        (Re-)initializes the user application as new and starts the game. Note: cannot be called during callbacks.

      • startLoadedGame

        protected void startLoadedGame(DataFile dataFile)
        (Re-)initializes the user application from the given data file and starts the game. Note: cannot be called during callbacks.
        Parameters:
        dataFile - save data to load from

      • getMenuListener

        public MenuEventListener getMenuListener()
        Returns:
        menu event handler associated with this game
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if menus are not enabled
